meanings.definition: A type of diuretic medication used to treat high blood pressure and edema.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a thiazide to help lower my blood pressure.
meanings.sent2: She takes a thiazide every morning to manage her swelling.
meanings.sent3: The thiazide worked like a magic pill, making the excess water disappear.
meanings.sent4: The thiazide acted as a water regulator in her body, like a tiny gatekeeper.
meanings.sent5: After taking the thiazide, she felt lighter and less bloated.

meanings.definition: Any of a class of drugs that inhibit reabsorption of sodium and chloride in the kidney, leading to increased excretion of water and electrolytes.
meanings.sent1: The thiazide medication helped her kidneys get rid of excess salt and water.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often recommend thiazides to patients with kidney issues.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the thiazide turned her into a human water fountain.
meanings.sent4: The thiazide was like a gatekeeper in her kidneys, letting go of the extra salt.
meanings.sent5: Taking the thiazide felt like flushing out all the unwanted substances from her body.
